title: More efficient logic needed to process disk sorting with border values for row values
OB: When sorting data on disk with a total of 40000 rows, the program processes only a portion of the data (less than 40000 rows). The program performs the following operations: 1. Saves the data as a temporary file. 2. Loads the temporary file into memory. 3. Performs a sorting operation on the data. 4. Saves the sorted data into another temporary file.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Sort 40000 rows of data on disk. 2. Set the program to process less than 40000 rows of data. 3. Observe the program performing the operations mentioned above.
